title: MEX Partition
statementHtml:
Let a partition of a multiset BB be a collection of multisets s1,s2,…,sks1,s2,…,sk such that each element appears the same number of times in BB and across all of s1,s2,…,sks1,s2,…,sk.

For example, some partitions of {1,2,3,3}{1,2,3,3} include {1,3}+{2,3},{1,2,3,3}{1,3}+{2,3},{1,2,3,3}, and {2}+{1,3}+{3}{2}+{1,3}+{3}, but not {1,2}+{3}{1,2}+{3}.

A partition is called valid if the mexmex∗∗ of all multisets in the partition is the same. The score of a valid partition is the mexmex of any multiset in the partition.

You are given a multiset AA of size nn. Find the minimum score over all valid partitions of AA.

∗∗The minimum excluded (MEX) of a collection of integers c1,c2,…,ckc1,c2,…,ck is defined as the smallest non-negative integer xx which does not occur in the collection cc.
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤1001≤t≤100). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains an integer nn (1≤n≤1001≤n≤100).

The second line contains nn integers A1,A2,…,AnA1,A2,…,An denoting the elements of AA (0≤Ai≤1000≤Ai≤100).

It is not guaranteed that the elements are given in non-decreasing order.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, output the minimum score over all valid partitions.
noteHtml:
In the first test case, the minimum score of 11 can be obtained by the partition {0}+{0}+{0}{0}+{0}+{0}. The partition is valid because each multiset has a mexmex of 11, which is consequently the score of the partition.

In the second test case, we can use {1,2}{1,2} as the only multiset in the partition, which has mex0mex⁡0.
